issue.title: Catalog number extraction and enhanced organization modes
issue.body:
## Summary
Implement catalog number extraction and integration for enhanced music library organization and discographic context.

## Problem Statement
Production analysis revealed extensive use of catalog numbers in album directory names and metadata files. These provide valuable discographic context that is currently being lost during organization.

## Current Implementation Gap
The existing path generation logic in `process_album_directory()` doesn't recognize or preserve catalog number information that could enhance organization.

Current target structure:
```
<DEST_DIR>/<Quality>/<Album Artist>/<Album Title> (<Year>)/
```

**Missing**: Catalog number preservation and integration.

## Real-World Examples
From production environment:

### Directory Names with Catalog Numbers
```
[1990] Tricky Disco - Tricky Disco [WAP 7CD]
[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001] Selway _ BPMF â€“ Untitled (1995) Vinyl WAV 16.44.1
playcd018 - soylent green - la forza del destino
Various artists - Sandwell District (FLAC WEB) [Sandwell District SDSMP1] 2010-06-01
```

### Catalog Number Patterns
- **Square brackets**: `[WAP 7CD]`, `[SDSMP1]`
- **Label prefixes**: `playcd018`, `SER.001`
- **Embedded notation**: `(Sandwell District SDSMP1)`
- **Format suffixes**: `[CD-FLAC]`, `[Vinyl WAV]`

## Proposed Solution

### 1. Catalog Number Detection
```bash
extract_catalog_number() {
    local input="$1"
    local catalog_patterns=(
        '\[([A-Z0-9][A-Z0-9\-\.\_\s]*[A-Z0-9])\]'      # [LABEL123], [WAP 7CD]
        '^([a-z]+[0-9]+)\s*-'                           # playcd018 -, srcd001 -
        '\(([A-Z]+[0-9]+[A-Z0-9]*)\)'                   # (SDSMP1), (KA108)
        '([A-Z]{2,}\s*[0-9]+[A-Z0-9\-]*)'             # SER.001, ECHO 003
    )
    
    for pattern in "${catalog_patterns[@]}"; do
        if [[ "$input" =~ $pattern ]]; then
            local extracted="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
            # Clean and standardize format
            extracted=$(echo "$extracted" | sed 's/[[:space:]]\+/ /g; s/^[[:space:]]*//; s/[[:space:]]*$//')
            echo "$extracted"
            return 0
        fi
    done
    
    return 1
}
```

### 2. Enhanced Metadata Extraction
```bash
extract_enhanced_metadata() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    local exiftool_output="$2"
    
    # Extract from directory name
    local dir_catalog=$(extract_catalog_number "$(basename "$album_dir")")
    
    # Extract from .nfo files if present
    local nfo_catalog=""
    local nfo_files=$(find "$album_dir" -name "*.nfo" -type f)
    if [[ -n "$nfo_files" ]]; then
        nfo_catalog=$(grep -i "catalog\|cat\s*#\|cat\s*no" "$nfo_files" | head -1 | \
                     sed 's/.*catalog[^:]*:?\s*//i; s/.*cat\s*#\s*//i; s/.*cat\s*no[^:]*:?\s*//i')
        nfo_catalog=$(echo "$nfo_catalog" | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//; s/^[[:space:]]*//')
    fi
    
    # Prefer explicit catalog from metadata, fallback to directory parsing
    local final_catalog="$nfo_catalog"
    if [[ -z "$final_catalog" && -n "$dir_catalog" ]]; then
        final_catalog="$dir_catalog"
    fi
    
    echo "$final_catalog"
}
```

### 3. Enhanced Directory Structure Options
```bash
generate_album_path_with_catalog() {
    local quality="$1"
    local album_artist="$2"  
    local album_title="$3"
    local album_year="$4"
    local catalog_number="$5"
    
    local sanitized_artist=$(sanitize_filename "$album_artist")
    local sanitized_title=$(sanitize_filename "$album_title")
    local year_part=""
    local catalog_part=""
    
    if [[ -n "$album_year" ]]; then
        year_part=" ($album_year)"
    fi
    
    if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
        catalog_part=" [$catalog_number]"
    fi
    
    # Option 1: Traditional with catalog
    echo "${DEST_DIR}/${quality}/${sanitized_artist}/${sanitized_title}${year_part}${catalog_part}"
}
```

### 4. Alternative Organization Schemes
```bash
# Option 2: Label-based organization
generate_label_organized_path() {
    local quality="$1"
    local album_artist="$2"
    local album_title="$3" 
    local album_year="$4"
    local catalog_number="$5"
    
    # Extract label from catalog (first part before number)
    local label=""
    if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
        label=$(echo "$catalog_number" | sed 's/[0-9].*//' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
    fi
    
    if [[ -n "$label" && ${#label} -gt 1 ]]; then
        echo "${DEST_DIR}/${quality}/Labels/${label}/${sanitized_artist} - ${sanitized_title}${year_part} [${catalog_number}]"
    else
        # Fallback to artist organization
        generate_album_path_with_catalog "$@"
    fi
}
```

## Configuration Options

### 5. User-Configurable Organization Mode
```bash
# Add to ordr.fm.conf
CATALOG_HANDLING="preserve"    # preserve, extract, ignore
ORGANIZATION_MODE="artist"     # artist, label, hybrid

# In ordr.fm.sh
case "$ORGANIZATION_MODE" in
    "label")
        proposed_path=$(generate_label_organized_path "$quality" "$album_artist" "$album_title" "$album_year" "$catalog_number")
        ;;
    "hybrid")
        # Use label organization for releases with catalog numbers, artist for others
        if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
            proposed_path=$(generate_label_organized_path "$@")
        else
            proposed_path=$(generate_album_path_with_catalog "$@")  
        fi
        ;;
    *)
        proposed_path=$(generate_album_path_with_catalog "$@")
        ;;
esac
```

## Integration with Existing Code

### Modified Album Processing
```bash
# In process_album_directory(), after metadata extraction:

# Extract catalog number
local catalog_number=$(extract_enhanced_metadata "$album_dir" "$exiftool_output")
if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
    log $LOG_DEBUG "Extracted catalog number: $catalog_number"
else
    log $LOG_DEBUG "No catalog number found"
fi

# Use enhanced path generation
local proposed_album_path=$(generate_album_path_with_catalog "$album_quality" "$album_artist" "$album_title" "$album_year" "$catalog_number")
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detects catalog numbers from directory names using multiple patterns
- [ ] Extracts catalog information from .nfo metadata files
- [ ] Preserves catalog numbers in organized directory structure
- [ ] Supports multiple organization modes (artist-based, label-based, hybrid)
- [ ] Configurable catalog handling (preserve, extract, ignore)
- [ ] Maintains backward compatibility with existing organization
- [ ] Handles edge cases (missing catalogs, malformed patterns)
- [ ] Test coverage includes real-world catalog number examples
- [ ] Documentation for configuration options

## Test Cases
Real-world examples from production:
```bash
test_cases=(
    "[WAP 7CD] Tricky Disco - Tricky Disco"           # Standard bracket format
    "playcd018 - soylent green - la forza del destino" # Prefix format  
    "[Sandwell District SDSMP1] Various - Compilation" # Complex catalog
    "Artist - Album (No Catalog)"                      # No catalog fallback
)
```

Expected results:
```
./test-output/Lossless/Tricky Disco/Tricky Disco (1990) [WAP 7CD]/
./test-output/Lossy/Soylent Green/La Forza Del Destino [playcd018]/
./test-output/Lossless/Labels/Sandwell District/Various - Compilation [SDSMP1]/
./test-output/Lossless/Artist/Album/
```

## Advanced Features (Future)
- Discogs/MusicBrainz catalog number validation
- Label database integration for enhanced metadata
- Catalog number-based duplicate detection
- Release format extraction (CD, Vinyl, Digital)

## Performance Considerations
- Catalog extraction adds minimal overhead (regex matching)
- .nfo file parsing only when files present
- Configurable - can be disabled for performance-critical scenarios

## Migration Strategy
- Default to existing behavior (preserve catalogs in names)
- Gradual migration with configuration options
- Dry-run mode shows both old and new path structures

    local album_year="$4"
    local catalog_number="$5"
    
    local sanitized_artist=$(sanitize_filename "$album_artist")
    local sanitized_title=$(sanitize_filename "$album_title")
    local year_part=""
    local catalog_part=""
    
    if [[ -n "$album_year" ]]; then
        year_part=" ($album_year)"
    fi
    
    if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
        catalog_part=" [$catalog_number]"
    fi
    
    # Option 1: Traditional with catalog
    echo "${DEST_DIR}/${quality}/${sanitized_artist}/${sanitized_title}${year_part}${catalog_part}"
}
```

### 4. Alternative Organization Schemes
```bash
# Option 2: Label-based organization
generate_label_organized_path() {
    local quality="$1"
    local album_artist="$2"
    local album_title="$3" 
    local album_year="$4"
    local catalog_number="$5"
    
    # Extract label from catalog (first part before number)
    local label=""
    if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
        label=$(echo "$catalog_number" | sed 's/[0-9].*//' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
    fi
    
    if [[ -n "$label" && ${#label} -gt 1 ]]; then
        echo "${DEST_DIR}/${quality}/Labels/${label}/${sanitized_artist} - ${sanitized_title}${year_part} [${catalog_number}]"
    else
        # Fallback to artist organization
        generate_album_path_with_catalog "$@"
    fi
}
```

## Configuration Options

### 5. User-Configurable Organization Mode
```bash
# Add to ordr.fm.conf
CATALOG_HANDLING="preserve"    # preserve, extract, ignore
ORGANIZATION_MODE="artist"     # artist, label, hybrid

# In ordr.fm.sh
case "$ORGANIZATION_MODE" in
    "label")
        proposed_path=$(generate_label_organized_path "$quality" "$album_artist" "$album_title" "$album_year" "$catalog_number")
        ;;
    "hybrid")
        # Use label organization for releases with catalog numbers, artist for others
        if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
            proposed_path=$(generate_label_organized_path "$@")
        else
            proposed_path=$(generate_album_path_with_catalog "$@")  
        fi
        ;;
    *)
        proposed_path=$(generate_album_path_with_catalog "$@")
        ;;
esac
```

## Integration with Existing Code

### Modified Album Processing
```bash
# In process_album_directory(), after metadata extraction:

# Extract catalog number
local catalog_number=$(extract_enhanced_metadata "$album_dir" "$exiftool_output")
if [[ -n "$catalog_number" ]]; then
    log $LOG_DEBUG "Extracted catalog number: $catalog_number"
else
    log $LOG_DEBUG "No catalog number found"
fi

# Use enhanced path generation
local proposed_album_path=$(generate_album_path_with_catalog "$album_quality" "$album_artist" "$album_title" "$album_year" "$catalog_number")
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detects catalog numbers from directory names using multiple patterns
- [ ] Extracts catalog information from .nfo metadata files
- [ ] Preserves catalog numbers in organized directory structure
- [ ] Supports multiple organization modes (artist-based, label-based, hybrid)
- [ ] Configurable catalog handling (preserve, extract, ignore)
- [ ] Maintains backward compatibility with existing organization
- [ ] Handles edge cases (missing catalogs, malformed patterns)
- [ ] Test coverage includes real-world catalog number examples
- [ ] Documentation for configuration options

## Test Cases
Real-world examples from production:
```bash
test_cases=(
    "[WAP 7CD] Tricky Disco - Tricky Disco"           # Standard bracket format
    "playcd018 - soylent green - la forza del destino" # Prefix format  
    "[Sandwell District SDSMP1] Various - Compilation" # Complex catalog
    "Artist - Album (No Catalog)"                      # No catalog fallback
)
```

Expected results:
```
./test-output/Lossless/Tricky Disco/Tricky Disco (1990) [WAP 7CD]/
./test-output/Lossy/Soylent Green/La Forza Del Destino [playcd018]/
./test-output/Lossless/Labels/Sandwell District/Various - Compilation [SDSMP1]/
./test-output/Lossless/Artist/Album/
```

## Advanced Features (Future)
- Discogs/MusicBrainz catalog number validation
- Label database integration for enhanced metadata
- Catalog number-based duplicate detection
- Release format extraction (CD, Vinyl, Digital)

## Performance Considerations
- Catalog extraction adds minimal overhead (regex matching)
- .nfo file parsing only when files present
- Configurable - can be disabled for performance-critical scenarios

## Migration Strategy
- Default to existing behavior (preserve catalogs in names)
- Gradual migration with configuration options
- Dry-run mode shows both old and new path structures

issue.title: Advanced subsidiary file handling (artwork, metadata, documentation)
issue.body:
## Summary
Implement comprehensive handling of subsidiary files (artwork, metadata, documentation) commonly found in music collections.

## Problem Statement
Production analysis revealed extensive use of subsidiary files that contain valuable metadata and documentation. Current implementation only handles basic image files, missing critical metadata preservation.

## Current Implementation Gap
**Location**: `ordr.fm.sh:389-397` only handles basic non-audio file moving:

```bash
# Move any remaining non-audio files (artwork, etc.) to destination
find "$album_dir" -type f \( ! -iname "*.mp3" -a ! -iname "*.flac" ... \) -exec mv {} "$proposed_album_path"/ \; 2>/dev/null
```

**Issues**:
- No classification or intelligent handling of different file types
- No preservation of metadata hierarchy
- Limited file type recognition

## Real-World File Types Found
From production environment analysis:

### Metadata Files
- **`.nfo`** - Album information and track listings (ubiquitous)
- **`.sfv`** - File verification checksums
- **`.m3u`** - Playlist files
- **`.cue`** - CD cue sheets for track boundaries
- **`.log`** - Ripping logs and verification

### Artwork Files  
- **`.jpg/.jpeg`** - Album covers, booklets, liner notes
- **`.png`** - High-quality artwork
- **`folder.jpg`** - Standard cover art
- **`front.jpg`**, **`back.jpg`** - Specific artwork components

### Documentation
- **`.txt`** - Release notes, credits
- **`.pdf`** - Digital booklets
- **`.html`** - Enhanced documentation

## Proposed Solution

### 1. File Classification System
```bash
classify_subsidiary_file() {
    local file_path="$1"
    local filename=$(basename "$file_path")
    local extension="${filename##*.}"
    
    case "${extension,,}" in
        nfo|sfv|m3u|cue|log)
            echo "metadata"
            ;;
        jpg|jpeg|png|gif|bmp)
            echo "artwork"  
            ;;
        txt|pdf|html|md)
            echo "documentation"
            ;;
        *)
            echo "other"
            ;;
    esac
}
```

### 2. Intelligent Subsidiary File Handling
```bash
process_subsidiary_files() {
    local source_dir="$1"
    local dest_dir="$2"
    
    # Find all non-audio files
    local subsidiary_files=()
    while IFS= read -r -d '' file; do
        subsidiary_files+=("$file")
    done < <(find "$source_dir" -type f \( ! -iname "*.mp3" -a ! -iname "*.flac" -a ! -iname "*.wav" -a ! -iname "*.m4a" -a ! -iname "*.aac" -a ! -iname "*.ogg" -a ! -iname "*.aiff" -a ! -iname "*.alac" \) -print0)
    
    for file in "${subsidiary_files[@]}"; do
        local file_type=$(classify_subsidiary_file "$file")
        local filename=$(basename "$file")
        
        case "$file_type" in
            metadata)
                # Preserve metadata files at album level
                cp "$file" "$dest_dir/$filename"
                log $LOG_DEBUG "Preserved metadata file: $filename"
                ;;
            artwork)
                # Handle artwork with standardized naming
                handle_artwork_file "$file" "$dest_dir"
                ;;
            documentation) 
                # Create docs subdirectory if needed
                mkdir -p "$dest_dir/Documentation"
                cp "$file" "$dest_dir/Documentation/$filename"
                log $LOG_DEBUG "Preserved documentation: $filename"
                ;;
            other)
                # Log but preserve unknown files
                cp "$file" "$dest_dir/$filename"
                log $LOG_WARNING "Unknown file type preserved: $filename"
                ;;
        esac
    done
}
```

### 3. Specialized Artwork Handling
```bash
handle_artwork_file() {
    local source_file="$1"
    local dest_dir="$2"
    local filename=$(basename "$source_file")
    local filename_lower="${filename,,}"
    
    # Standardize common artwork names
    case "$filename_lower" in
        folder.jpg|cover.jpg|front.jpg)
            cp "$source_file" "$dest_dir/cover.jpg"
            log $LOG_DEBUG "Standardized cover art: $filename â†’ cover.jpg"
            ;;
        back.jpg|rear.jpg)
            cp "$source_file" "$dest_dir/back.jpg"
            ;;
        *)
            # Preserve with original name for other artwork
            cp "$source_file" "$dest_dir/$filename"
            ;;
    esac
}
```

## Advanced Features

### 4. Metadata File Analysis
```bash
analyze_nfo_file() {
    local nfo_file="$1"
    
    # Extract useful metadata from .nfo files
    if [[ -f "$nfo_file" ]]; then
        local catalog_number=$(grep -i "catalog" "$nfo_file" | head -1)
        local label=$(grep -i "label" "$nfo_file" | head -1)
        local year=$(grep -i "year\|date" "$nfo_file" | head -1)
        
        log $LOG_DEBUG "NFO metadata - Catalog: $catalog_number, Label: $label, Year: $year"
    fi
}
```

### 5. File Verification Integration  
```bash
verify_sfv_checksums() {
    local sfv_file="$1"
    local album_dir="$2"
    
    if [[ -f "$sfv_file" ]]; then
        log $LOG_INFO "SFV checksum file found, performing verification..."
        # Could integrate with existing checksum verification
        # sfv files contain CRC32 checksums for integrity checking
    fi
}
```

## Integration Points

### Modified Album Processing
```bash
# In process_album_directory(), after successful track moves:
if [[ $move_errors -eq 0 ]]; then
    # Process subsidiary files after audio files
    process_subsidiary_files "$album_dir" "$proposed_album_path"
    
    # Analyze metadata files if present  
    local nfo_files=$(find "$proposed_album_path" -name "*.nfo")
    for nfo_file in $nfo_files; do
        analyze_nfo_file "$nfo_file"
    done
fi
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Classifies and handles .nfo, .sfv, .m3u, .cue, .log metadata files
- [ ] Preserves all artwork files with intelligent naming
- [ ] Creates Documentation subdirectory for text/PDF files
- [ ] Maintains file integrity during subsidiary file moves
- [ ] Integrates with existing checksum verification
- [ ] Logs subsidiary file processing for audit trails
- [ ] Works with both dry-run and live modes
- [ ] Handles edge cases (duplicate names, special characters)
- [ ] Test coverage includes real-world subsidiary file examples

## Test Cases
Using production examples:
- Albums with comprehensive .nfo files
- Multiple artwork files (front.jpg, back.jpg, booklet.pdf)
- .sfv checksum verification files
- .cue sheet files for CD structure

## Performance Considerations
- Process subsidiary files after audio files (main workflow priority)
- Use efficient file classification (single pass through directory)
- Minimal overhead for albums without subsidiary files

## Future Enhancements
- Extract catalog numbers from .nfo files for enhanced organization
- Integrate .sfv checksums with existing verification system
- Parse .cue files for enhanced track boundary information
- Support for embedded artwork extraction from audio files

issue.title: Production deployment safety enhancements and batch processing
issue.body:
## Summary
**Critical**: Implement additional safety measures and validation checks for large-scale production deployment.

## Problem Statement
Production environment contains **7,878 directories** and extensive music collection. Current safety measures are adequate for small collections but need enhancement for large-scale deployment to prevent data loss or organization errors.

## Current Safety Features âœ…
- âœ… Dry-run mode by default
- âœ… Checksum verification for file integrity
- âœ… Conflict resolution with timestamping
- âœ… Comprehensive logging
- âœ… Error isolation (problematic albums â†’ unsorted)

## Additional Safety Requirements for Production

### 1. Pre-Flight Validation System
```bash
validate_production_readiness() {
    local source_dir="$1"
    local dest_dir="$2"
    
    log $LOG_INFO "Performing pre-flight validation for production deployment..."
    
    # Disk space validation
    local source_size=$(du -sb "$source_dir" | cut -f1)
    local dest_available=$(df "$dest_dir" | tail -1 | awk '{print $4 * 1024}')
    local safety_margin=$((source_size * 2))  # 2x source size for safety
    
    if [[ $dest_available -lt $safety_margin ]]; then
        log $LOG_FATAL "FATAL: Insufficient disk space. Need $safety_margin bytes, have $dest_available"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Directory count validation  
    local dir_count=$(find "$source_dir" -type d | wc -l)
    if [[ $dir_count -gt 10000 ]]; then
        log $LOG_WARNING "Large directory count detected: $dir_count directories"
        log $LOG_WARNING "Consider processing in batches for better performance"
    fi
    
    # Permission validation
    if [[ ! -w "$dest_dir" ]]; then
        log $LOG_FATAL "FATAL: No write permission to destination: $dest_dir"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log $LOG_INFO "Pre-flight validation passed"
    return 0
}
```

### 2. Batch Processing Mode
```bash
# Add to configuration
BATCH_SIZE=100          # Process max 100 albums at a time
BATCH_DELAY=5           # 5 second delay between batches
PROGRESS_REPORTING=1    # Enable progress reporting

process_in_batches() {
    local source_dir="$1"
    local album_dirs=()
    
    while IFS= read -r -d '' album_dir; do
        album_dirs+=("$album_dir")
    done < <(find "$source_dir" -type d -print0)
    
    local total_albums=${#album_dirs[@]}
    local processed=0
    local batch_num=1
    
    log $LOG_INFO "Processing $total_albums albums in batches of $BATCH_SIZE"
    
    for ((i=0; i<$total_albums; i+=$BATCH_SIZE)); do
        log $LOG_INFO "Batch $batch_num: Processing albums $((i+1))-$((i+BATCH_SIZE)) of $total_albums"
        
        # Process batch
        for ((j=i; j<i+BATCH_SIZE && j<total_albums; j++)); do
            process_album_directory "${album_dirs[j]}"
            ((processed++))
            
            # Progress reporting
            if [[ $((processed % 10)) -eq 0 ]]; then
                local percent=$((processed * 100 / total_albums))
                log $LOG_INFO "Progress: $processed/$total_albums albums ($percent%)"
            fi
        done
        
        # Inter-batch delay for system stability
        if [[ $i+$BATCH_SIZE -lt $total_albums ]]; then
            log $LOG_INFO "Batch complete. Pausing ${BATCH_DELAY}s before next batch..."
            sleep $BATCH_DELAY
        fi
        
        ((batch_num++))
    done
}
```

### 3. Resume Capability
```bash
# State tracking for resume capability
STATE_FILE="$LOG_FILE.state"

save_progress_state() {
    local processed_dir="$1"
    echo "$processed_dir" >> "$STATE_FILE"
}

load_resume_state() {
    if [[ -f "$STATE_FILE" ]]; then
        log $LOG_INFO "Resume state found. Loading previously processed directories..."
        return 0
    fi
    return 1
}

is_already_processed() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    if [[ -f "$STATE_FILE" ]]; then
        grep -Fxq "$album_dir" "$STATE_FILE"
        return $?
    fi
    return 1
}

# Modified album processing with resume capability
process_album_directory_with_resume() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    
    # Skip if already processed
    if is_already_processed "$album_dir"; then
        log $LOG_DEBUG "Skipping already processed: $album_dir"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Process album
    if process_album_directory "$album_dir"; then
        save_progress_state "$album_dir"
    fi
}
```

### 4. Enhanced Error Recovery
```bash
# Detailed error categorization
categorize_error() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    local error_type="$2"
    
    case "$error_type" in
        "metadata")
            log $LOG_WARNING "Metadata error in '$album_dir' - moved to unsorted"
            ;;
        "filesystem")
            log $LOG_ERROR "Filesystem error in '$album_dir' - check permissions"
            ;;
        "integrity")
            log $LOG_ERROR "Integrity error in '$album_dir' - possible corruption"
            ;;
        "space")
            log $LOG_FATAL "Disk space error - stopping processing"
            return 1
            ;;
    esac
}

# Enhanced error handling in album processing
process_album_directory_safe() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    
    # Trap errors for detailed reporting
    local error_occurred=0
    
    # Check available space before processing
    local required_space=$(du -sb "$album_dir" | cut -f1)
    local available_space=$(df "$DEST_DIR" | tail -1 | awk '{print $4 * 1024}')
    
    if [[ $available_space -lt $((required_space * 2)) ]]; then
        categorize_error "$album_dir" "space"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Process with error handling
    if ! process_album_directory "$album_dir"; then
        error_occurred=1
        # Determine error type and handle appropriately
        if [[ ! -w "$DEST_DIR" ]]; then
            categorize_error "$album_dir" "filesystem"
        else
            categorize_error "$album_dir" "metadata"
        fi
    fi
    
    return $error_occurred
}
```

### 5. Production Monitoring
```bash
# Real-time statistics tracking
declare -A STATS
STATS[processed]=0
STATS[errors]=0
STATS[skipped]=0
STATS[moved_files]=0
STATS[moved_bytes]=0

update_stats() {
    local stat_type="$1"
    local value="${2:-1}"
    
    STATS[$stat_type]=$((${STATS[$stat_type]} + value))
    
    # Periodic reporting
    if [[ $((${STATS[processed]} % 50)) -eq 0 ]]; then
        report_statistics
    fi
}

report_statistics() {
    log $LOG_INFO "=== Production Statistics ==="
    log $LOG_INFO "Processed: ${STATS[processed]} albums"
    log $LOG_INFO "Errors: ${STATS[errors]} albums"
    log $LOG_INFO "Skipped: ${STATS[skipped]} albums"
    log $LOG_INFO "Files moved: ${STATS[moved_files]}"
    log $LOG_INFO "Data moved: $(numfmt --to=iec ${STATS[moved_bytes]})"
    log $LOG_INFO "============================="
}
```

### 6. Emergency Stop Mechanism
```bash
# Signal handlers for graceful shutdown
STOP_FILE="/tmp/ordr.fm.stop"

setup_signal_handlers() {
    # Clean shutdown on SIGTERM/SIGINT
    trap 'handle_shutdown' TERM INT
    
    # Check for stop file periodically
    trap 'check_stop_file' USR1
}

handle_shutdown() {
    log $LOG_WARNING "Shutdown signal received. Finishing current album..."
    echo "SHUTDOWN_REQUESTED" > "$STOP_FILE"
    exit 0
}

check_stop_file() {
    if [[ -f "$STOP_FILE" ]]; then
        log $LOG_WARNING "Stop file detected. Graceful shutdown initiated."
        report_statistics
        exit 0
    fi
}

# Emergency stop command
create_stop_file() {
    echo "STOP_REQUESTED_$(date)" > "$STOP_FILE"
    log $LOG_WARNING "Emergency stop requested. Processing will halt after current album."
}
```

## Enhanced CLI Options

### 7. Production Mode Flags
```bash
# New command line options
parse_arguments() {
    while [[ "$#" -gt 0 ]]; do
        case "$1" in
            --production)
                PRODUCTION_MODE=1
                log $LOG_INFO "Production mode enabled"
                shift
                ;;
            --batch-size)
                BATCH_SIZE="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --resume)
                RESUME_MODE=1
                shift
                ;;
            --stop)
                create_stop_file
                exit 0
                ;;
            --validate-only)
                VALIDATE_ONLY=1
                shift
                ;;
            # ... existing options
        esac
    done
}
```

## Integration Points

### Modified Main Function
```bash
main() {
    parse_arguments "$@"
    
    # Production readiness validation
    if [[ $PRODUCTION_MODE -eq 1 ]] || [[ $VALIDATE_ONLY -eq 1 ]]; then
        if ! validate_production_readiness "$SOURCE_DIR" "$DEST_DIR"; then
            exit 1
        fi
        
        if [[ $VALIDATE_ONLY -eq 1 ]]; then
            log $LOG_INFO "Validation complete. Exiting."
            exit 0
        fi
    fi
    
    # Setup safety mechanisms
    setup_signal_handlers
    
    # Resume capability
    if [[ $RESUME_MODE -eq 1 ]]; then
        load_resume_state
    fi
    
    # Process with appropriate method
    if [[ $PRODUCTION_MODE -eq 1 ]] && [[ $BATCH_SIZE -gt 0 ]]; then
        process_in_batches "$SOURCE_DIR"
    else
        # Standard processing
        process_all_albums "$SOURCE_DIR"
    fi
    
    # Final reporting
    report_statistics
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Pre-flight validation checks disk space, permissions, directory counts
- [ ] Batch processing mode for large collections (configurable batch size)
- [ ] Resume capability with state tracking for interrupted runs
- [ ] Enhanced error categorization and recovery
- [ ] Real-time statistics and progress reporting
- [ ] Emergency stop mechanism with graceful shutdown
- [ ] Production mode CLI flags and validation
- [ ] Comprehensive logging of all safety operations
- [ ] Performance monitoring and regression detection
- [ ] Documentation for production deployment procedures

## Usage Examples
```bash
# Validate readiness without processing
./ordr.fm.sh --validate-only --source /home/plex/Music

# Production mode with batching
./ordr.fm.sh --production --batch-size 50 --source /home/plex/Music --move

# Resume interrupted processing
./ordr.fm.sh --resume --production --move

# Emergency stop (from another terminal)
./ordr.fm.sh --stop
```

## Risk Mitigation
- **Data Loss Prevention**: Multiple validation layers and checksum verification
- **System Stability**: Batch processing and inter-batch delays
- **Graceful Recovery**: Resume capability and detailed error categorization
- **Monitoring**: Real-time statistics and progress reporting
- **Emergency Response**: Signal handlers and stop file mechanism

## Performance Characteristics
- Batch processing reduces memory usage for large collections
- Progress state tracking adds minimal overhead
- Statistics collection impacts <1% performance
- Validation adds ~30 seconds overhead for large collections

issue.title: Production deployment safety enhancements and batch processing
issue.body:
## Summary
**Critical**: Implement additional safety measures and validation checks for large-scale production deployment.

## Problem Statement
Production environment contains **7,878 directories** and extensive music collection. Current safety measures are adequate for small collections but need enhancement for large-scale deployment to prevent data loss or organization errors.

## Current Safety Features âœ…
- âœ… Dry-run mode by default
- âœ… Checksum verification for file integrity
- âœ… Conflict resolution with timestamping
- âœ… Comprehensive logging
- âœ… Error isolation (problematic albums â†’ unsorted)

## Additional Safety Requirements for Production

### 1. Pre-Flight Validation System
```bash
validate_production_readiness() {
    local source_dir="$1"
    local dest_dir="$2"
    
    log $LOG_INFO "Performing pre-flight validation for production deployment..."
    
    # Disk space validation
    local source_size=$(du -sb "$source_dir" | cut -f1)
    local dest_available=$(df "$dest_dir" | tail -1 | awk '{print $4 * 1024}')
    local safety_margin=$((source_size * 2))  # 2x source size for safety
    
    if [[ $dest_available -lt $safety_margin ]]; then
        log $LOG_FATAL "FATAL: Insufficient disk space. Need $safety_margin bytes, have $dest_available"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Directory count validation  
    local dir_count=$(find "$source_dir" -type d | wc -l)
    if [[ $dir_count -gt 10000 ]]; then
        log $LOG_WARNING "Large directory count detected: $dir_count directories"
        log $LOG_WARNING "Consider processing in batches for better performance"
    fi
    
    # Permission validation
    if [[ ! -w "$dest_dir" ]]; then
        log $LOG_FATAL "FATAL: No write permission to destination: $dest_dir"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log $LOG_INFO "Pre-flight validation passed"
    return 0
}
```

### 2. Batch Processing Mode
```bash
# Add to configuration
BATCH_SIZE=100          # Process max 100 albums at a time
BATCH_DELAY=5           # 5 second delay between batches
PROGRESS_REPORTING=1    # Enable progress reporting

process_in_batches() {
    local source_dir="$1"
    local album_dirs=()
    
    while IFS= read -r -d '' album_dir; do
        album_dirs+=("$album_dir")
    done < <(find "$source_dir" -type d -print0)
    
    local total_albums=${#album_dirs[@]}
    local processed=0
    local batch_num=1
    
    log $LOG_INFO "Processing $total_albums albums in batches of $BATCH_SIZE"
    
    for ((i=0; i<$total_albums; i+=$BATCH_SIZE)); do
        log $LOG_INFO "Batch $batch_num: Processing albums $((i+1))-$((i+BATCH_SIZE)) of $total_albums"
        
        # Process batch
        for ((j=i; j<i+BATCH_SIZE && j<total_albums; j++)); do
            process_album_directory "${album_dirs[j]}"
            ((processed++))
            
            # Progress reporting
            if [[ $((processed % 10)) -eq 0 ]]; then
                local percent=$((processed * 100 / total_albums))
                log $LOG_INFO "Progress: $processed/$total_albums albums ($percent%)"
            fi
        done
        
        # Inter-batch delay for system stability
        if [[ $i+$BATCH_SIZE -lt $total_albums ]]; then
            log $LOG_INFO "Batch complete. Pausing ${BATCH_DELAY}s before next batch..."
            sleep $BATCH_DELAY
        fi
        
        ((batch_num++))
    done
}
```

### 3. Resume Capability
```bash
# State tracking for resume capability
STATE_FILE="$LOG_FILE.state"

save_progress_state() {
    local processed_dir="$1"
    echo "$processed_dir" >> "$STATE_FILE"
}

load_resume_state() {
    if [[ -f "$STATE_FILE" ]]; then
        log $LOG_INFO "Resume state found. Loading previously processed directories..."
        return 0
    fi
    return 1
}

is_already_processed() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    if [[ -f "$STATE_FILE" ]]; then
        grep -Fxq "$album_dir" "$STATE_FILE"
        return $?
    fi
    return 1
}

# Modified album processing with resume capability
process_album_directory_with_resume() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    
    # Skip if already processed
    if is_already_processed "$album_dir"; then
        log $LOG_DEBUG "Skipping already processed: $album_dir"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Process album
    if process_album_directory "$album_dir"; then
        save_progress_state "$album_dir"
    fi
}
```

### 4. Enhanced Error Recovery
```bash
# Detailed error categorization
categorize_error() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    local error_type="$2"
    
    case "$error_type" in
        "metadata")
            log $LOG_WARNING "Metadata error in '$album_dir' - moved to unsorted"
            ;;
        "filesystem")
            log $LOG_ERROR "Filesystem error in '$album_dir' - check permissions"
            ;;
        "integrity")
            log $LOG_ERROR "Integrity error in '$album_dir' - possible corruption"
            ;;
        "space")
            log $LOG_FATAL "Disk space error - stopping processing"
            return 1
            ;;
    esac
}

# Enhanced error handling in album processing
process_album_directory_safe() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    
    # Trap errors for detailed reporting
    local error_occurred=0
    
    # Check available space before processing
    local required_space=$(du -sb "$album_dir" | cut -f1)
    local available_space=$(df "$DEST_DIR" | tail -1 | awk '{print $4 * 1024}')
    
    if [[ $available_space -lt $((required_space * 2)) ]]; then
        categorize_error "$album_dir" "space"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Process with error handling
    if ! process_album_directory "$album_dir"; then
        error_occurred=1
        # Determine error type and handle appropriately
        if [[ ! -w "$DEST_DIR" ]]; then
            categorize_error "$album_dir" "filesystem"
        else
            categorize_error "$album_dir" "metadata"
        fi
    fi
    
    return $error_occurred
}
```

### 5. Production Monitoring
```bash
# Real-time statistics tracking
declare -A STATS
STATS[processed]=0
STATS[errors]=0
STATS[skipped]=0
STATS[moved_files]=0
STATS[moved_bytes]=0

update_stats() {
    local stat_type="$1"
    local value="${2:-1}"
    
    STATS[$stat_type]=$((${STATS[$stat_type]} + value))
    
    # Periodic reporting
    if [[ $((${STATS[processed]} % 50)) -eq 0 ]]; then
        report_statistics
    fi
}

report_statistics() {
    log $LOG_INFO "=== Production Statistics ==="
    log $LOG_INFO "Processed: ${STATS[processed]} albums"
    log $LOG_INFO "Errors: ${STATS[errors]} albums"
    log $LOG_INFO "Skipped: ${STATS[skipped]} albums"
    log $LOG_INFO "Files moved: ${STATS[moved_files]}"
    log $LOG_INFO "Data moved: $(numfmt --to=iec ${STATS[moved_bytes]})"
    log $LOG_INFO "============================="
}
```

### 6. Emergency Stop Mechanism
```bash
# Signal handlers for graceful shutdown
STOP_FILE="/tmp/ordr.fm.stop"

setup_signal_handlers() {
    # Clean shutdown on SIGTERM/SIGINT
    trap 'handle_shutdown' TERM INT
    
    # Check for stop file periodically
    trap 'check_stop_file' USR1
}

handle_shutdown() {
    log $LOG_WARNING "Shutdown signal received. Finishing current album..."
    echo "SHUTDOWN_REQUESTED" > "$STOP_FILE"
    exit 0
}

check_stop_file() {
    if [[ -f "$STOP_FILE" ]]; then
        log $LOG_WARNING "Stop file detected. Graceful shutdown initiated."
        report_statistics
        exit 0
    fi
}

# Emergency stop command
create_stop_file() {
    echo "STOP_REQUESTED_$(date)" > "$STOP_FILE"
    log $LOG_WARNING "Emergency stop requested. Processing will halt after current album."
}
```

## Enhanced CLI Options

### 7. Production Mode Flags
```bash
# New command line options
parse_arguments() {
    while [[ "$#" -gt 0 ]]; do
        case "$1" in
            --production)
                PRODUCTION_MODE=1
                log $LOG_INFO "Production mode enabled"
                shift
                ;;
            --batch-size)
                BATCH_SIZE="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --resume)
                RESUME_MODE=1
                shift
                ;;
            --stop)
                create_stop_file
                exit 0
                ;;
            --validate-only)
                VALIDATE_ONLY=1
                shift
                ;;
            # ... existing options
        esac
    done
}
```

## Integration Points

### Modified Main Function
```bash
main() {
    parse_arguments "$@"
    
    # Production readiness validation
    if [[ $PRODUCTION_MODE -eq 1 ]] || [[ $VALIDATE_ONLY -eq 1 ]]; then
        if ! validate_production_readiness "$SOURCE_DIR" "$DEST_DIR"; then
            exit 1
        fi
        
        if [[ $VALIDATE_ONLY -eq 1 ]]; then
            log $LOG_INFO "Validation complete. Exiting."
            exit 0
        fi
    fi
    
    # Setup safety mechanisms
    setup_signal_handlers
    
    # Resume capability
    if [[ $RESUME_MODE -eq 1 ]]; then
        load_resume_state
    fi
    
    # Process with appropriate method
    if [[ $PRODUCTION_MODE -eq 1 ]] && [[ $BATCH_SIZE -gt 0 ]]; then
        process_in_batches "$SOURCE_DIR"
    else
        # Standard processing
        process_all_albums "$SOURCE_DIR"
    fi
    
    # Final reporting
    report_statistics
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Pre-flight validation checks disk space, permissions, directory counts
- [ ] Batch processing mode for large collections (configurable batch size)
- [ ] Resume capability with state tracking for interrupted runs
- [ ] Enhanced error categorization and recovery
- [ ] Real-time statistics and progress reporting
- [ ] Emergency stop mechanism with graceful shutdown

## Usage Examples
```bash
# Validate readiness without processing
./ordr.fm.sh --validate-only --source /home/plex/Music

# Production mode with batching
./ordr.fm.sh --production --batch-size 50 --source /home/plex/Music --move

issue.title: Real-world test data integration and enhanced test coverage
issue.body:
## Summary
Integrate real-world production edge cases into the test framework to ensure comprehensive coverage of complex scenarios.

## Problem Statement
Current test suite uses simplified synthetic test data. Production environment analysis revealed complex edge cases that aren't covered by existing tests, creating gaps in validation coverage.

## Current Test Coverage Gap
**Location**: `test-runner.sh` currently tests:
- Basic MP3 and FLAC processing
- Simple filename sanitization  
- Basic conflict resolution

**Missing**: Real-world complexity found in production environment.

## Real-World Test Data Available
Successfully captured **2.5GB of production edge cases** in `test-data-real-world/`:

1. **`[1990] Tricky Disco`** (89MB) - Square brackets + year formatting
2. **`[1994] Beauty - Forward`** (304MB) - WAV files + bracket notation
3. **`[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]`** (229MB) - Unicode en-dash + catalog numbers
4. **`2012 - Change in Dynamic Environment`** (98MB) - Year prefix + long titles
5. **`Arjun_Vagale-Exit_Fragments-WAV_Digital`** (768MB) - Format designation
6. **`playcd018 - soylent green`** (160MB) - Catalog prefix + lowercase
7. **`Various artists - Sandwell District`** (243MB) - Complex compilations
8. **`vibe (underground resistance)`** (231MB) - **Multi-album structure**
9. **`WAVS`** (8MB) - Misleading directory (FLAC files in WAV-named dir)

## Proposed Solution

### 1. Enhanced Test Framework Structure
```bash
# New test organization
test-data/                     # Existing simple cases
test-data-real-world/         # Production edge cases  
test-data-synthetic/          # Generated edge cases
test-results/                 # Test output validation
```

### 2. Real-World Test Cases
```bash
# Add to test-runner.sh

# Test 9: Unicode character preservation
test_unicode_characters() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]*" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Verify Unicode en-dash (â€“) is preserved in output path
    if find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -name "*â€“*" | grep -q "Serotonin"; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Unicode en-dash not preserved in output path"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 10: Multi-album directory handling  
test_multi_album_structure() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/vibe (underground resistance)" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Verify multiple albums were processed separately
    local album_count=$(find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -mindepth 3 -maxdepth 3 -type d | wc -l)
    if [[ $album_count -ge 3 ]]; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Multi-album structure not properly handled. Found $album_count albums, expected â‰¥3"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 11: WAV format processing
test_wav_processing() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/[1994] Beauty - Forward" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Check that WAV files were moved to Lossless directory
    if [[ -d "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" ]] && find "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" -name "*.wav" | grep -q .; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "WAV files not properly processed as lossless"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 12: Catalog number preservation
test_catalog_number_preservation() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/playcd018*" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Verify catalog number is preserved in some form
    if find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -name "*playcd018*" -o -name "*018*" | grep -q .; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Catalog number information not preserved"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 13: Subsidiary file handling
test_subsidiary_files() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/Various artists - Sandwell District*" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Check that .nfo files were preserved
    local nfo_count=$(find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -name "*.nfo" | wc -l)
    if [[ $nfo_count -gt 0 ]]; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Subsidiary .nfo files not preserved"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 14: Format classification accuracy
test_format_classification() {
    setup_test_env
    
    # Test misleading directory name (WAVS contains FLAC)
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/WAVS" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Should classify as Lossless based on actual file content, not directory name
    if [[ -d "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" ]] && find "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" -name "*.flac" | grep -q .; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Format classification failed - should detect FLAC as lossless despite WAV directory name"
        return 1
    fi
}
```

### 3. Extended Test Runner
```bash
# Modified main() function in test-runner.sh
main() {
    log_info "Starting ordr.fm comprehensive test suite with real-world data..."
    echo "========================================"
    
    # Existing tests
    run_test "Dry run functionality" test_dry_run
    run_test "MP3 (Lossy) file processing" test_mp3_processing  
    run_test "FLAC (Lossless) file processing" test_flac_processing
    run_test "Filename sanitization" test_filename_sanitization
    run_test "Conflict resolution" test_conflict_resolution
    run_test "Dependency checking" test_dependency_checking
    run_test "Help functionality" test_help_functionality
    run_test "Checksum verification" test_checksum_verification
    
    # New real-world tests
    run_test "Unicode character preservation" test_unicode_characters
    run_test "Multi-album directory handling" test_multi_album_structure  
    run_test "WAV format processing" test_wav_processing
    run_test "Catalog number preservation" test_catalog_number_preservation
    run_test "Subsidiary file handling" test_subsidiary_files
    run_test "Format classification accuracy" test_format_classification
    
    # Summary and results...
}
```

### 4. Test Data Validation
```bash
validate_test_data() {
    log_info "Validating real-world test data integrity..."
    
    # Check that real-world test data exists
    if [[ ! -d "test-data-real-world" ]]; then
        log_error "Real-world test data not found. Run setup script to download."
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Verify key test cases are present
    local required_cases=(
        "vibe (underground resistance)"
        "[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]*"
        "WAVS"
        "playcd018*"
    )
    
    for case in "${required_cases[@]}"; do
        if ! ls test-data-real-world/$case 1> /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_warning "Missing test case: $case"
        fi
    done
}
```

### 5. Performance Benchmarking
```bash
benchmark_real_world_performance() {
    log_info "Benchmarking performance with real-world data..."
    
    local start_time=$(date +%s)
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world" --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    local end_time=$(date +%s)
    
    local duration=$((end_time - start_time))
    log_info "Real-world test suite completed in ${duration}s"
    
    # Performance regression check
    if [[ $duration -gt 300 ]]; then  # 5 minutes
        log_warning "Performance regression: test suite took ${duration}s (>5min)"
    fi
}
```

## Implementation Strategy

### Phase 1: Basic Integration
- Add real-world test cases to existing test runner
- Implement Unicode and multi-album tests
- Validate against current functionality

### Phase 2: Advanced Testing  
- Add catalog number and subsidiary file tests
- Implement performance benchmarking
- Create test data validation suite

### Phase 3: Continuous Integration
- Automate real-world test execution
- Add performance regression detection
- Integrate with GitHub Actions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Real-world test data integrated into test framework
- [ ] 6 new test cases covering production edge cases
- [ ] Unicode character preservation validation
- [ ] Multi-album structure detection testing
- [ ] Format classification accuracy verification
- [ ] Subsidiary file handling validation
- [ ] Performance benchmarking with real-world data
- [ ] Test data validation and integrity checking
- [ ] Documentation for new test cases
- [ ] CI integration for automated testing

## Benefits
- **Comprehensive Coverage**: Real production scenarios tested
- **Regression Prevention**: Edge cases caught early
- **Performance Validation**: Large dataset performance monitoring  
- **Quality Assurance**: Production-ready validation

## Test Execution
```bash
# Run full test suite including real-world cases
./test-runner.sh

# Run only real-world tests
./test-runner.sh --real-world-only

# Performance benchmark
./test-runner.sh --benchmark
```

## Dependencies
- Real-world test data (already captured in `test-data-real-world/`)
- Enhanced test framework capabilities
- Performance monitoring utilities

## Future Enhancements
- Automated test data refresh from production
- Machine learning-based edge case detection
- Fuzzing test generation from real patterns

issue.title: Real-world test data integration and enhanced test coverage
issue.body:
## Summary
Integrate real-world production edge cases into the test framework to ensure comprehensive coverage of complex scenarios.

## Problem Statement
Current test suite uses simplified synthetic test data. Production environment analysis revealed complex edge cases that aren't covered by existing tests, creating gaps in validation coverage.

## Current Test Coverage Gap
**Location**: `test-runner.sh` currently tests:
- Basic MP3 and FLAC processing
- Simple filename sanitization  
- Basic conflict resolution

**Missing**: Real-world complexity found in production environment.

## Real-World Test Data Available
Successfully captured **2.5GB of production edge cases** in `test-data-real-world/`:

1. **`[1990] Tricky Disco`** (89MB) - Square brackets + year formatting
2. **`[1994] Beauty - Forward`** (304MB) - WAV files + bracket notation
3. **`[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]`** (229MB) - Unicode en-dash + catalog numbers
4. **`2012 - Change in Dynamic Environment`** (98MB) - Year prefix + long titles
5. **`Arjun_Vagale-Exit_Fragments-WAV_Digital`** (768MB) - Format designation
6. **`playcd018 - soylent green`** (160MB) - Catalog prefix + lowercase
7. **`Various artists - Sandwell District`** (243MB) - Complex compilations
8. **`vibe (underground resistance)`** (231MB) - **Multi-album structure**
9. **`WAVS`** (8MB) - Misleading directory (FLAC files in WAV-named dir)

## Proposed Solution

### 1. Enhanced Test Framework Structure
```bash
# New test organization
test-data/                     # Existing simple cases
test-data-real-world/         # Production edge cases  
test-data-synthetic/          # Generated edge cases
test-results/                 # Test output validation
```

### 2. Real-World Test Cases
```bash
# Add to test-runner.sh

# Test 9: Unicode character preservation
test_unicode_characters() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]*" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Verify Unicode en-dash (â€“) is preserved in output path
    if find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -name "*â€“*" | grep -q "Serotonin"; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Unicode en-dash not preserved in output path"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 10: Multi-album directory handling  
test_multi_album_structure() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/vibe (underground resistance)" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Verify multiple albums were processed separately
    local album_count=$(find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -mindepth 3 -maxdepth 3 -type d | wc -l)
    if [[ $album_count -ge 3 ]]; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Multi-album structure not properly handled. Found $album_count albums, expected â‰¥3"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 11: WAV format processing
test_wav_processing() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/[1994] Beauty - Forward" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Check that WAV files were moved to Lossless directory
    if [[ -d "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" ]] && find "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" -name "*.wav" | grep -q .; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "WAV files not properly processed as lossless"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 12: Catalog number preservation
test_catalog_number_preservation() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/playcd018*" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Verify catalog number is preserved in some form
    if find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -name "*playcd018*" -o -name "*018*" | grep -q .; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Catalog number information not preserved"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 13: Subsidiary file handling
test_subsidiary_files() {
    setup_test_env
    
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/Various artists - Sandwell District*" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Check that .nfo files were preserved
    local nfo_count=$(find "$TEST_OUTPUT" -name "*.nfo" | wc -l)
    if [[ $nfo_count -gt 0 ]]; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Subsidiary .nfo files not preserved"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test 14: Format classification accuracy
test_format_classification() {
    setup_test_env
    
    # Test misleading directory name (WAVS contains FLAC)
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world/WAVS" --move --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Should classify as Lossless based on actual file content, not directory name
    if [[ -d "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" ]] && find "$TEST_OUTPUT/Lossless" -name "*.flac" | grep -q .; then
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Format classification failed - should detect FLAC as lossless despite WAV directory name"
        return 1
    fi
}
```

### 3. Extended Test Runner
```bash
# Modified main() function in test-runner.sh
main() {
    log_info "Starting ordr.fm comprehensive test suite with real-world data..."
    echo "========================================"
    
    # Existing tests
    run_test "Dry run functionality" test_dry_run
    run_test "MP3 (Lossy) file processing" test_mp3_processing  
    run_test "FLAC (Lossless) file processing" test_flac_processing
    run_test "Filename sanitization" test_filename_sanitization
    run_test "Conflict resolution" test_conflict_resolution
    run_test "Dependency checking" test_dependency_checking
    run_test "Help functionality" test_help_functionality
    run_test "Checksum verification" test_checksum_verification
    
    # New real-world tests
    run_test "Unicode character preservation" test_unicode_characters
    run_test "Multi-album directory handling" test_multi_album_structure  
    run_test "WAV format processing" test_wav_processing
    run_test "Catalog number preservation" test_catalog_number_preservation
    run_test "Subsidiary file handling" test_subsidiary_files
    run_test "Format classification accuracy" test_format_classification
    
    # Summary and results...
}
```

### 4. Test Data Validation
```bash
validate_test_data() {
    log_info "Validating real-world test data integrity..."
    
    # Check that real-world test data exists
    if [[ ! -d "test-data-real-world" ]]; then
        log_error "Real-world test data not found. Run setup script to download."
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Verify key test cases are present
    local required_cases=(
        "vibe (underground resistance)"
        "[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]*"
        "WAVS"
        "playcd018*"
    )
    
    for case in "${required_cases[@]}"; do
        if ! ls test-data-real-world/$case 1> /dev/null 2>&1; then
            log_warning "Missing test case: $case"
        fi
    done
}
```

### 5. Performance Benchmarking
```bash
benchmark_real_world_performance() {
    log_info "Benchmarking performance with real-world data..."
    
    local start_time=$(date +%s)
    "$MAIN_SCRIPT" --source "./test-data-real-world" --verbose > /dev/null 2>&1
    local end_time=$(date +%s)
    
    local duration=$((end_time - start_time))
    log_info "Real-world test suite completed in ${duration}s"
    
    # Performance regression check
    if [[ $duration -gt 300 ]]; then  # 5 minutes
        log_warning "Performance regression: test suite took ${duration}s (>5min)"
    fi
}
```

## Implementation Strategy

### Phase 1: Basic Integration
- Add real-world test cases to existing test runner
- Implement Unicode and multi-album tests
- Validate against current functionality

### Phase 2: Advanced Testing  
- Add catalog number and subsidiary file tests
- Implement performance benchmarking
- Create test data validation suite

### Phase 3: Continuous Integration
- Automate real-world test execution
- Add performance regression detection
- Integrate with GitHub Actions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Real-world test data integrated into test framework
- [ ] 6 new test cases covering production edge cases
- [ ] Unicode character preservation validation
- [ ] Multi-album structure detection testing
- [ ] Format classification accuracy verification
- [ ] Subsidiary file handling validation
- [ ] Performance benchmarking with real-world data
- [ ] Test data validation and integrity checking
- [ ] Documentation for new test cases
- [ ] CI integration for automated testing

## Benefits
- **Comprehensive Coverage**: Real production scenarios tested
- **Regression Prevention**: Edge cases caught early
- **Performance Validation**: Large dataset performance monitoring  
- **Quality Assurance**: Production-ready validation

## Test Execution
```bash
# Run full test suite including real-world cases
./test-runner.sh

# Run only real-world tests
./test-runner.sh --real-world-only

# Performance benchmark
./test-runner.sh --benchmark
```

## Dependencies
- Real-world test data (already captured in `test-data-real-world/`)
- Enhanced test framework capabilities
- Performance monitoring utilities

## Future Enhancements
- Automated test data refresh from production
- Machine learning-based edge case detection
- Fuzzing test generation from real patterns

issue.title: Enhanced Unicode character support in filename sanitization
issue.body:
## Summary
**Critical**: Enhance filename sanitization to properly handle Unicode characters commonly found in music metadata.

## Problem Statement
Production analysis revealed extensive use of Unicode characters in album and artist names that are being corrupted by the current sanitization logic. This causes loss of legitimate typographic characters and potential metadata corruption.

## Current Implementation Issue
**Location**: `sanitize_filename()` in `ordr.fm.sh:81-88`

Current implementation:
```bash
sanitize_filename() {
    local input="$1"
    # Remove or replace problematic characters
    local sanitized=$(echo "$input" | sed 's/[\\/:*?"<>|]\+/_/g')
    # Trim leading/trailing spaces and replace multiple spaces with a single space
    sanitized=$(echo "$sanitized" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//;s/[[:space:]]*$//;s/[[:space:]]\+/ /g')
    echo "$sanitized"
}
```

**Issue**: Doesn't account for legitimate Unicode characters vs filesystem-unsafe characters.

## Real-World Examples
From production environment:
- `[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001]` - Contains Unicode en-dash (â€“) vs ASCII hyphen (-)
- `Various artists â€“ Sandwell District` - En-dash in artist names
- `Move D â€“ House Grooves Vol. 1` - Typographic separators

## Character Analysis
**Legitimate Unicode (should preserve)**:
- En-dash: `â€“` (U+2013)
- Em-dash: `â€”` (U+2014) 
- Smart quotes: `"` `"` `'` `'`
- Musical symbols: `â™ª` `â™«` `â™¬`
- Accented characters: `Ã©` `Ã±` `Ã¼` etc.

**Filesystem unsafe (should replace)**:
- Forward slash: `/`
- Backslash: `\`
- Colon: `:`
- Asterisk: `*`
- Question mark: `?`
- Quote marks: `"` (straight)
- Pipe: `|`
- Angle brackets: `<` `>`

## Proposed Solution

### Enhanced Sanitization Function
```bash
sanitize_filename() {
    local input="$1"
    
    # Only replace characters that are actually filesystem-unsafe
    # Preserve Unicode typography while replacing problematic ASCII
    local sanitized="$input"
    
    # Replace filesystem-unsafe characters with underscores
    sanitized=$(echo "$sanitized" | sed 's/[\\/:*?"<>|]/_/g')
    
    # Replace problematic control characters but preserve printable Unicode
    sanitized=$(echo "$sanitized" | sed 's/[[:cntrl:]]/_/g')
    
    # Trim and normalize whitespace (preserve Unicode spaces)
    sanitized=$(echo "$sanitized" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//;s/[[:space:]]*$//;s/[[:space:]]\+/ /g')
    
    # Handle edge case: if result is empty or only underscores, use fallback
    if [[ -z "$sanitized" ]] || [[ "$sanitized" =~ ^_+$ ]]; then
        sanitized="untitled"
    fi
    
    echo "$sanitized"
}
```

### Unicode-Aware Testing Function
```bash
test_unicode_preservation() {
    local test_cases=(
        "Artist â€“ Album Name"
        "CafÃ© de Flore"
        "BjÃ¶rk & Thom Yorke"
        "Various â€Žâ€“ Compilation"
        "Bad/Path:Name"
        "Smart "Quotes" Test"
    )
    
    for test_case in "${test_cases[@]}"; do
        local result=$(sanitize_filename "$test_case")
        log $LOG_DEBUG "Unicode test: '$test_case' â†’ '$result'"
    done
}
```

## Implementation Strategy

### 1. Preserve Legitimate Characters
- Keep en-dash, em-dash, accented characters
- Maintain typographic quotes and musical symbols
- Preserve Unicode spaces and punctuation

### 2. Replace Only Unsafe Characters
- Target specific filesystem-problematic characters
- Use character classes more precisely
- Test against actual filesystem limitations

### 3. Enhanced Testing
- Add Unicode test cases to test suite
- Test with real-world production examples
- Validate cross-platform compatibility

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Preserves Unicode en-dash (â€“) and em-dash (â€”) characters
- [ ] Maintains accented characters (Ã©, Ã±, Ã¼, etc.)
- [ ] Replaces only filesystem-unsafe ASCII characters
- [ ] Handles empty results with fallback naming
- [ ] Works correctly on macOS, Linux, Windows filesystems
- [ ] Test coverage includes real-world Unicode examples
- [ ] No regression in existing ASCII filename handling
- [ ] Performance impact minimal (<5% overhead)

## Test Cases
Using real production examples:
```bash
test_cases=(
    "[Serotonin â€Žâ€“ SER.001] Selway _ BPMF â€“ Untitled"  # Should preserve â€“
    "CafÃ© de Flore â€“ Morning Session"                   # Should preserve Ã© and â€“
    "Bad/Path:Name*File"                               # Should replace /:*
    "BjÃ¶rk & Sigur RÃ³s"                               # Should preserve Ã¶
)
```

## Platform Considerations
- **macOS**: UTF-8 native, supports most Unicode
- **Linux**: UTF-8 standard, good Unicode support  
- **Windows**: May need additional validation for NTFS limitations

## Risk Assessment
**Impact**: P0 Critical - Metadata corruption affects organization accuracy
**Complexity**: Medium - Requires careful character class definitions
**Testing**: High - Real Unicode examples available

## Performance Notes
- Use efficient `sed` patterns rather than character-by-character processing
- Cache compiled regex patterns if possible
- Benchmark against current implementation

issue.title: Add multi-album directory detection and handling
issue.body:
## Summary
**Critical**: Add detection and proper handling of directories containing multiple albums as subdirectories.

## Problem Statement
Production analysis revealed directories like `vibe (underground resistance)` that contain **multiple separate albums as subdirectories** rather than tracks. The current implementation assumes one album per directory, which would incorrectly process these as a single malformed album.

## Current Implementation Gap
**Location**: `process_album_directory()` in `ordr.fm.sh:121`

The current logic:
```bash
# Find all audio files within the album directory (maxdepth 1)
find "$album_dir" -maxdepth 1 -type f \( -iname "*.mp3" ... \) -print0
```

**Issue**: Only processes files at the top level, ignoring legitimate album subdirectories.

## Real-World Examples
From production environment (`test-data-real-world/`):
```
vibe (underground resistance)/
â”œâ”€â”€ v 1001 - midi mechanixx - pump wid acid/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ 01--pump_wid_dis.mp3
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ 02--pump_wid_dis_(toronto_mix).mp3
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ album.nfo
â”œâ”€â”€ v 1002 - ron andrews - if it don't stank/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ 01-ron_andrews--if_it_dont_stank_(radio_mix)-mbs.mp3
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ album.nfo
â””â”€â”€ v lp 1 - underground resistance - hype stuff/
    â”œâ”€â”€ 01-underground_resistance--timeline.mp3
    â””â”€â”€ album.nfo
```

## Proposed Solution

### 1. Multi-Album Detection Function
```bash
detect_multi_album_structure() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    
    # Check for subdirectories containing audio files
    local subdirs_with_audio=()
    while IFS= read -r -d '' subdir; do
        if [[ $(find "$subdir" -maxdepth 1 -name "*.mp3" -o -name "*.flac" -o -name "*.wav" 2>/dev/null | wc -l) -gt 0 ]]; then
            subdirs_with_audio+=("$subdir")
        fi
    done < <(find "$album_dir" -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type d -print0)
    
    if [[ ${#subdirs_with_audio[@]} -gt 1 ]]; then
        echo "${subdirs_with_audio[@]}"
        return 0
    fi
    return 1
}
```

### 2. Modified Album Processing Logic
```bash
process_album_directory() {
    local album_dir="$1"
    
    # Check for multi-album structure first
    local sub_albums
    if sub_albums=$(detect_multi_album_structure "$album_dir"); then
        log $LOG_INFO "Multi-album structure detected in '$album_dir'. Processing ${#sub_albums[@]} sub-albums."
        
        # Process each sub-album individually
        for sub_album in $sub_albums; do
            log $LOG_INFO "Processing sub-album: $(basename "$sub_album")"
            process_album_directory "$sub_album"
        done
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Continue with existing single-album logic...
}
```

### 3. Integration Points
- **Location**: Insert detection before existing audio file search in `process_album_directory()`
- **Logging**: Add multi-album detection to debug output
- **Testing**: Add test case with `vibe (underground resistance)` structure

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detects directories containing multiple album subdirectories
- [ ] Processes each sub-album individually with proper metadata extraction
- [ ] Maintains existing behavior for single-album directories
- [ ] Logs multi-album detection for user awareness
- [ ] Works with both dry-run and live modes
- [ ] Test coverage includes real-world multi-album example
- [ ] Handles nested structures (label â†’ album â†’ tracks)

## Risk Assessment
**Impact**: P0 Critical - Without this fix, label collections will be incorrectly processed
**Complexity**: Medium - Requires recursive processing logic
**Testing**: High - Real-world test case available in `test-data-real-world/`

## Implementation Notes
- Preserve existing single-album performance (most common case)
- Use recursive approach for nested structures
- Maintain consistent logging patterns
- Ensure conflict resolution works at sub-album level

## Related Issues
- Will unlock proper handling of label compilations and box sets
- Foundation for advanced catalog number extraction (#TBD)

issue.body:
# ðŸ“Š Performance Monitoring & Optimization for Career Intelligence Dashboard

## Overview
Implement comprehensive performance monitoring, optimization, and observability for the Career Intelligence Dashboard to ensure enterprise-grade performance, reliability, and user experience at scale.

## Business Value
- **Professional Excellence**: Sub-second load times demonstrate technical competency
- **User Retention**: Optimal performance keeps stakeholders engaged
- **Scalability Readiness**: Performance foundation supports future feature growth
- **Competitive Advantage**: Superior UX differentiates from competitors

## Performance Monitoring Features

### Real-Time Performance Metrics
- [ ] **Core Web Vitals Tracking**: LCP, FID, CLS monitoring with alerting
- [ ] **Custom Performance Metrics**: Dashboard-specific timing and interaction metrics
- [ ] **User Experience Analytics**: Session duration, bounce rate, feature engagement
- [ ] **Error Rate Monitoring**: JavaScript errors, API failures, data loading issues

### Advanced Observability
- [ ] **Performance Dashboard**: Real-time metrics visualization with historical trends
- [ ] **User Journey Analytics**: Track navigation patterns and bottlenecks
- [ ] **Resource Utilization**: Memory usage, network requests, rendering performance
- [ ] **Geographic Performance**: Regional load time analysis and CDN optimization

### Automated Optimization
- [ ] **Dynamic Resource Loading**: Lazy loading for charts and heavy components
- [ ] **Intelligent Caching**: Smart cache strategies for GitHub API and market data
- [ ] **Image Optimization**: WebP conversion and responsive image delivery
- [ ] **Code Splitting**: Modular loading of dashboard components

### Performance Alerting
- [ ] **Threshold-Based Alerts**: Automated notifications for performance degradation
- [ ] **Anomaly Detection**: AI-powered identification of unusual performance patterns
- [ ] **Uptime Monitoring**: Global endpoint monitoring with SLA tracking
- [ ] **Budget Monitoring**: Performance budget enforcement with CI/CD integration

## Technical Implementation

### Monitoring Infrastructure
- [ ] **Google Analytics 4**: Enhanced ecommerce and user engagement tracking
- [ ] **Google PageSpeed Insights API**: Automated performance scoring
- [ ] **Real User Monitoring (RUM)**: Browser timing API integration
- [ ] **Synthetic Monitoring**: Automated Lighthouse auditing via GitHub Actions

### Optimization Techniques
- [ ] **Critical CSS Inlining**: Above-the-fold content optimization
- [ ] **JavaScript Bundle Optimization**: Tree shaking, minification, compression
- [ ] **CDN Integration**: Chart.js and asset delivery optimization
- [ ] **Service Worker Implementation**: Offline functionality and asset caching

### Performance Testing
- [ ] **Load Testing**: Simulated user scenarios with K6 or Artillery
- [ ] **Stress Testing**: Breaking point analysis for concurrent users
- [ ] **Performance Regression Testing**: CI/CD integration with performance budgets
- [ ] **Mobile Performance Testing**: Device-specific optimization validation

### Data Optimization
- [ ] **API Response Caching**: Intelligent GitHub API response caching with TTL
- [ ] **Data Compression**: Gzip/Brotli compression for large datasets
- [ ] **Incremental Loading**: Progressive data loading for large activity histories
- [ ] **Background Updates**: Non-blocking data refresh with user notifications

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Monitoring Foundation (Weeks 1-2)
- Implement Core Web Vitals tracking and performance metrics collection
- Set up Google Analytics 4 with custom events and user journey tracking
- Create performance dashboard with real-time metrics visualization
- Configure automated Lighthouse auditing in GitHub Actions

### Phase 2: Optimization Implementation (Weeks 2-3)
- Implement lazy loading for charts and heavy dashboard components
- Optimize JavaScript bundles with code splitting and tree shaking
- Add intelligent caching for API responses and computed analytics
- Configure CDN integration for static assets and chart libraries

### Phase 3: Advanced Features (Weeks 3-4)
- Deploy service worker for offline functionality and asset caching
- Implement automated performance alerting and anomaly detection
- Add load testing with simulated user scenarios and stress testing
- Create performance budget enforcement in CI/CD pipeline

## Success Criteria

### Performance Targets
- [ ] **Loading Performance**: <2 seconds initial load, <1 second subsequent loads
- [ ] **Core Web Vitals**: LCP <2.5s, FID <100ms, CLS <0.1
- [ ] **Mobile Performance**: >90 Lighthouse mobile score
- [ ] **Network Efficiency**: <500KB initial payload, progressive enhancement

### Monitoring Excellence
- [ ] **Real-Time Visibility**: <5-minute detection of performance issues
- [ ] **Historical Analytics**: 6+ months of performance trend data
- [ ] **Alerting Reliability**: <1% false positive rate for performance alerts
- [ ] **Global Coverage**: Performance monitoring across 5+ geographic regions

### User Experience
- [ ] **Perceived Performance**: 95%+ users report "fast" experience
- [ ] **Reliability**: 99.9% uptime with graceful degradation
- [ ] **Accessibility**: Performance optimization doesn't compromise accessibility
- [ ] **Progressive Enhancement**: Core functionality works without JavaScript

## Integration Points
- **Monitors**: Career Intelligence Dashboard (#145)
- **Enhances**: Real-time dashboard updates and user interactions
- **Connects to**: GitHub Actions for automated performance testing
- **Leverages**: Existing CDN and hosting infrastructure

## Monitoring Stack
- **Web Analytics**: Google Analytics 4 with custom events
- **Performance Monitoring**: Google PageSpeed Insights API + custom metrics
- **Uptime Monitoring**: GitHub Actions + external monitoring service
- **Error Tracking**: Browser Error API + centralized logging

## Risk Mitigation
- **Performance Regression**: Automated testing prevents performance degradation
- **Monitoring Overhead**: Minimal impact from monitoring instrumentation
- **Cost Management**: Efficient monitoring with budget controls
- **Data Privacy**: GDPR-compliant analytics with user consent management

---

**Strategic Impact**: This monitoring and optimization foundation ensures the Career Intelligence Dashboard maintains professional-grade performance standards while providing deep insights into user engagement and system health.

issue.body:
# ðŸ“Š Workflow Performance Monitoring

## Overview
Implement comprehensive workflow performance monitoring and analytics within GitHub Actions to provide insights into CI/CD pipeline efficiency, resource usage, and optimization opportunities.

## Business Value
- **Performance Optimization**: Identify and resolve CI bottlenecks
- **Cost Management**: Track resource usage and optimize workflow costs
- **Quality Metrics**: Monitor test suite performance and reliability
- **Continuous Improvement**: Data-driven workflow optimization

## Requirements

### GitHub Actions Insights
- [ ] **Workflow Analytics**: Detailed execution time analysis across all workflows
- [ ] **Job Performance**: Individual job timing and resource usage tracking
- [ ] **Success Rates**: Workflow reliability and failure analysis
- [ ] **Resource Usage**: CPU, memory, and storage consumption tracking

### Custom Metrics Collection
- [ ] **Test Suite Metrics**: Performance tracking for all 6 enterprise test suites
- [ ] **Build Metrics**: Container build times, artifact sizes, cache hit rates
- [ ] **Deployment Metrics**: Deployment success rates, rollback frequency
- [ ] **Security Metrics**: Vulnerability scan results and remediation times

### Performance Dashboards
- [ ] **CI Performance Dashboard**: Real-time workflow performance visualization
- [ ] **Trend Analysis**: Historical performance trends and regression detection
- [ ] **Resource Utilization**: GitHub Actions minutes usage and optimization
- [ ] **Quality Metrics**: Test coverage, security scores, performance benchmarks

### Alerting & Notifications
- [ ] **Performance Alerts**: Automated alerts for workflow performance degradation
- [ ] **Resource Alerts**: Notifications for high resource usage or quota limits
- [ ] **Quality Alerts**: Test failure notifications and quality gate breaches
- [ ] **Optimization Recommendations**: Automated suggestions for workflow improvements

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Metrics Collection
- Implement workflow timing and performance data collection
- Add custom metrics collection to existing workflows
- Set up resource usage tracking and monitoring
- Configure test suite performance measurement

### Phase 2: Analytics & Reporting
- Create performance dashboards using GitHub Actions artifacts
- Implement trend analysis and historical data tracking
- Add automated performance reporting and summaries
- Configure quality metrics tracking and visualization

### Phase 3: Optimization & Alerts
- Set up automated alerting for performance issues
- Implement workflow optimization recommendations
- Add resource usage optimization suggestions
- Configure continuous improvement monitoring

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Complete visibility into all workflow performance metrics
- [ ] Automated performance regression detection
- [ ] 20%+ improvement in CI execution times through optimization
- [ ] Proactive alerting for performance and quality issues

## Technical Specifications

### Metrics Collection Example
```yaml
- name: Collect Performance Metrics
  run: |
    echo "workflow_duration=$(date +%s)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    echo "test_count=$(find . -name '*.test.js' | wc -l)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    echo "coverage_percent=$(npm run coverage | grep -o '[0-9]*%')" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

- name: Upload Metrics
  uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: performance-metrics
    path: metrics.json
```

### Dashboard Generation
```yaml
- name: Generate Performance Dashboard
  run: |
    node .github/scripts/generate-dashboard.js
    cp dashboard.html $GITHUB_WORKSPACE/docs/performance/

- name: Deploy Dashboard
  uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
  with:
    github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
    publish_dir: ./docs/performance
```

## Dependencies
- GitHub Actions workflows and job execution data
- Custom metrics collection scripts
- Dashboard generation and visualization tools
- Integration with existing CI/CD pipeline

## Labels
`ci-cd`, `enhancement`, `P2: Medium`, `monitoring`, `analytics`
